author: Ellyn Lapointe
title: Hurricane watchers increase threat of storm Patty hitting the US
text:
AccuWeather meteorologists say there is a 90 percent chance that a storm will form in the Caribbean this weekend or early next week, potentially hitting the US. It would be named Patty. Storm Patty is brewing in the Caribbean - and there's a good chance it hits the US.
AccuWeather meteorologists are monitoring a disturbance that could strengthen as it moves into the central or west where conditions are optimal for development.
Lead hurricane expert Alex DaSilva, said: 'Next week, most of the wind shear will shift to the north, and so it will basically create a pocket with high ocean temperatures, plenty of moisture and very low wind shear that will be favorable for tropical development.'
There are two potential paths this storm could take: one to the west and the other to the north.
The western track is unlikely to impact the US, but it could hit South Florida if the storm gains momentum in the next seven days.
'Storms in the Caribbean usually move to the north or northeast in November. This means that residents and visitors from Florida (including the Gulf Coast) to the Carolinas will have to keep a close eye on development,' DaSilva said.
This has prompted the National Hurricane Center (NHC) to slightly increase the chances of a tropical disturbance forming in the next seven days.
AccuWeather meteorologists say there is a 90 percent chance that hurricane will form in the Caribbean this weekend or early next week, potentially hitting the US
DaSilva added: 'Even if a tropical storm forms and tracks into Mexico or Central America, changing steering winds can turn that storm to the…
Ellyn Lapointe

author: /autor/andrea-guemarez-soto/
title: Encuentran en buen estado de salud a mujer reportada como desaparecida en Río Piedras - El Nuevo Día
text: Ashley Marie Avilés Carmona, de 29 años, había sido vista por última vez en marzo 18 de abril de 2024 - 5:15 PM Ashley Marie Avilés Carmona, de 29 años, había sido vista por última vez en marzo 18 de abril de 2024 - 5:15 PM Una mujer sin hogar que fue reportada como [desaparecida ](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/personas-desaparecidas/)en [Río Piedras ](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/rio-piedras/)tras ser vista por última vez en marzo fue localizada el jueves en buen estado de salud, confirmó la Oficina del Coordinador de Personas Desaparecidas de la Superintendencia Auxiliar en Investigaciones Criminales (SAIC). De acuerdo con la requisitoria de la [Policía](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/policia-de-puerto-rico/), Ashley Marie Avilés Carmona, de 29 años, había sido reportada como desaparecida por su madre. Asimismo, Avilés Carmona había sido descrita con una estatura de cinco pies y dos pulgadas (5′2′'), con un peso aproximado de 115 libras, de tez negra, ojos marrones y cabello marrón. Tras su localización, quedan sin efecto las labores de búsqueda por parte de la Uniformada. Te invitamos a descargar cualquiera de estos navegadores para ver nuestras noticias:

author: Qatar Tribune
title: Estithmar Holding signs agreementto manage 492-bed hospital in Iraq - Read Qatar Tribune on the go for unrivalled news coverage
text:
Tribune News Network
Baghdad
Elegancia Healthcare WLL, a subsidiary of Estithmar Holding, has entered into a strategic agreement with Iraqi Ministry of Health to manage and operate the 492-bed Al Nasiriya Teaching Hospital in Dhi Qaar Governorate, Iraq.
The operation and management of the hospital will start in two months.
The agreement was signed by Dr Rashid Najm Al Khalidi, director-general of Dhi Qar Health Department; and Mohammed Al Dawamna, in his capacity as a Board Member of Estithmar Holding, in the presence of Minister of Health Dr Saleh Mahdi Al Hasnawi, Ambassador of Qatar to Iraq HE Sultan bin Mubarak Al Kubaisi and Chief Executive Officer of Elegancia Healthcare Joseph Hazel.
The agreement aims to elevate the current healthcare standards at Al Nasiriya Teaching
Hospital, in addition to enhancing operational efficiency, improving service levels and expanding its medical specialties. It also seeks to achieve these goals by adopting the latest administrative and operational methodologies, leveraging Elegancia Healthcare’s extensive expertise and excellence in managing and operating healthcare facilities.
The scope of the agreement includes providing tailored medical services to meet the needs of residents in the governorate and neighbouring areas. It involves providing Al Nasiriya Teaching Hospital with a diverse team of international and local medical experts.
The scope of work covers comprehensive healthcare services, including medical procedures and the operational and maintenance aspects of the hospital, as well as managing human resources, supply chain and offering technical support.
Commenting on the collaboration, Eng Mohamed Bin Badr Al-Sadah, CEO of Estithmar Holding said, “This strategic move further enriches and adds to the number of projects and healthcare initiatives spearheaded by Estithmar Holding in Iraq. Through this agreement, Elegancia Healthcare will undertake the management and operation of Al Nasiriya Teaching Hospital in the upcoming two months to ensure the delivery of top-tier healthcare services.”
He added, “This agreement underscores our dedication to our business strategy which seeks to expand our presence in the healthcare sector. Our goal is to work towards enhancing and expanding our business portfolio to foster growth opportunities and add value for our shareholders, especially that this agreement will commence in the next two months.”
Elegancia Healthcare, a subsidiary of Estithmar Holding, boasts an extensive track record in successfully operating and managing several hospitals. Among its notable ventures, Elegancia co-owns and operates The View Hospital in collaboration with Cedars- Sinai, and the Korean Medical Center in Darb Lusail, Qatar, in partnership with prominent Korean medical institutions, including Asan Medical Center, AHNKANG, EHL Bio, Lime Tree Dental Hospital and JK Medical Group.
The company has also broadened its global presence commencing the establishment of the Algerian-Qatari-German Hospital in partnership with the Algerian Ministry of Health.
Additionally, Elegancia Healthcare has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Ministry of Health of Uzbekistan to establish a multi-specialty healthcare facility and undertake other healthcare initiatives across various countries.
All the operation and management agreements signed by Estithmar Holding abroad benefit the local economy by promoting the import of hard currency and exporting local expertise abroad.
 Copy 05/04/2024 10

organizations.name: tribune news network baghdad elegancia healthcare wll

author: Clarence E. Hill Jr. - Fort Worth Star-Telegram (TNS)
title: Dallas Cowboys’ Micah Parsons remains frustrated by officiating
text:
Dallas Cowboys edge rusher Micah Parsons remains frustrated with he perceives as unfair treatment from NFL officials and continues to voice his displeasure over the lack of holding calls against him.
Parsons is one of the league’s premier pass rushers and he joins Hall of Famer Reggie White as the only players in NFL history with at least 13 sacks in each of his first three seasons.

author: NA
title: Aurelius Tech to benefit from automotive, IoT sectors | The Star
text:
PETALING JAYA: Maybank Investment Bank Research (Maybank IB Research) is positive about Aurelius Technologies Bhd ’s (ATech) growth and has placed a “buy” call on the group.
The research house did however trim its target price to RM3.05 from RM3.13, as the group shifted its fiscal year-end to December from January.
In a note, Maybank IB Research said things are looking up for the multi-component semiconductor provider as it gains a competitive edge in two high-growth sectors – the Internet of Things (IoT) and electric vehicles.
ATech has said it plans to diversify and enhance its IoT infrastructure together with its automotive-manufacturing segment, which will undertake more selective investments as the group aims to take on more projects and gain new customers.
The research house said ATech will stand to benefit from all this, as well as supply-chain diversification and foreign direct investments in the electrical and electronics sector.
“We remain optimistic about ATech’s growth and have forecast a 16% compounded annual growth rate in core earnings for the next three years. Signs of recovery from customer-destocking headwinds are evident and earnings growth will be supported by new-model wins and the acquisition of new customers, backed by the group’s expansion initiatives,” Maybank IB Research said.
Meanwhile, the research house said ATech’s nine-month revenue this year declined 12% to RM302.5mil, on the back of aggressive inventory downsizing by customers that led to a lower production volume.“Despite this, gross profit margin improved slightly thanks to a better product mix. Core net profit rose 2% year-on-year to RM25.8mil, driven by effective cost control and lower finance costs,” the research house said.
Revenue growth of 14% for electric devices cushioned the declines in communications, IoT and semiconductor components (C&I/SC).
“Looking at quarter-on-quarter performance, electric devices outperformed with a 29% sales increase, while C&I/SC experienced contractions of 13% and 40% respectively.
“The strength in the electric-devices segment is mainly attributed to increased demand from an oil and gas (O&G) customer, fuelled by recent activity in O&G sector,” the research house noted.
Furthermore, Maybank IB Research said that ATech’s order book as of Dec 11, had significantly increased to RM473mil from RM322mil on Sept 19, indicating the end of inventory destocking by customers.
The research house noted some of the risks it foresees included weaker demands from customers, a lower than expected costs pass through and operational disruptions from labour issues or component shortages.
Open Modal ×

author: @petitbleuagen
title: Pro D2 : rapidement réduit en infériorité numérique, le SU Agen renverse le Biarritz Olympique dans un match totalement fou
text:
Pro D2 : rapidement réduit en infériorité numérique, le SU Agen renverse le Biarritz Olympique dans un match totalement fou
Complètement déchaînés, les Agenais, en infériorité numérique une bonne partie de la rencontre, ont totalement renversé une rencontre pourtant bien mal embarquée.
Six jours après la défaite face à Provence (10-17), le SUA s’était promis de réagir. Il a tenu promesse. Dès l’entame. Sur une pénalité récupérée, Billy Searle trouve une touche dans les 22 mètres. Après un bon maul des avants, le ballon est écarté.
A lire aussi :
SU Agen : en 1985, une fin d’aventure particulière pour Joël Llop
Lancé dans l’intervalle, Loris Tolot résiste au retour de la défense pour aplatir un premier essai cousu main (5-0, 3e). Mais la réaction biarrote est immédiate, et intervient dans un tout autre style. En force. Après plusieurs temps de jeu au ras, Piula Fa’asalele transperce la défense agenaise (5-7, 8e).
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : feu d’artifice, bandas, food-trucks… Le SU Agen prépare une belle soirée à Armandie pour le match contre Biarritz
Le SUA réduit à quatorze
Tout est à refaire dans une rencontre rythmée et agréable. Chaque formation se répond du tac au tac. De retour dans le camp adverse, le SUA est précis. Dorian Bellot profite de l’avancée pour se faufiler en bord de regroupement et remettre les siens devant.
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : John Madigan fait son retour avec le SU Agen pour défier Biarritz
Tout du moins, c’est ce qu’on croyait. L’essai est refusé à la vidéo pour une faute d’Iban Etcheverry (15e). Le combat continue. Et ce sont au tour des Biarrots de contrer. Mathieu Acebes décale Yohan Tapie sur son aile.
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : "C’est tout pour moi…" Libre depuis son départ du SU Agen, le Gallois Joe Maksymiw annonce la fin de sa carrière
En débordement, l’ailier pousse le ballon au pied et profite du rebond favorable pour réaliser un premier break (5-14, 21e). Le scénario catastrophe se dessine.
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : "Je voudrais travailler ici après ma carrière…" Evan Olmstead est tombé amoureux de la France et du SU Agen
D’autant plus après le carton rouge infligé à Hans Lombard-Buret, coupable d’avoir déblayé Yohan Beheregaray de manière virulente (23e). Sur l’action suivante, le BO, par l’intermédiaire de Retière, sur un petit côté bien négocié, trouve à nouveau la faille (5-19, 26e).
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : "On a le couteau entre les dents" Un SU Agen revanchard pour la réception du Biarritz Olympique
À ce moment-là, on ne voit pas comment le Sporting peut revenir. Mais pourtant, il va le faire. En bon capitaine, Peyo Muscarditz montre la voie à suivre, en s’infiltrant au ras d’un regroupement (12-19, 28e).
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : "Je souhaite qu’il vienne…" Le SU Agen accélère sur le mercato en visant Romain Briatte et Uzair Cassiem
Et le Sporting, trascendé, repart à l’attaque, refusant les trois points pour aller en pénaltouche. Un choix gagnant. Le maul avance et envoie Valentin Gayraud dans l’en-but. Agen recolle (19-19, 33e).
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : "Je me sens de plus en plus impliqué dans ce rôle…" Peyo Muscarditz est en train de devenir un leader du SU Agen
La fin de première période est électique, avec un arbitre ne maîtrisant pas la rencontre. Etcheverry et Beheregaray en font les frais (39e). À treize, le Sporting enfonce les Basques. Bellot joue bien le petit côté, et décale Tolot pour mettre les Agenais en tête aux vestiaires (26-19, 40e).
A lire aussi :
Pro D2 : le demi de mêlée du SU Agen Dorian Bellot prolonge son contrat pour trois saisons
Un SUA déchaîné
Agen débute la seconde période comme la première. Rapidement, le Sporting se retrouve à cinq mètres de l’en-but, mais perd inexplicablement le ballon. Sur le contre, Biarritz n’est pas loin d’égaliser (45e).
Une grosse frayeur ne rafraîchissant par un SUA métamorphosé. Logiquement, Searle concrétise la domination des siens à deux reprises (32-19, 57e).
Et le score pourrait même être plus impressionnant, tant les Agenais se montrent irrésistibles, claquant un formidable 27-0 en étant en infériorité numérique. Et même un 34-0 !
Car, après un lancement bien travaillé, Kolinio Ramoka explose tout sur son passage pour embraser un Armandie soudainement réchauffé (39-19, 62e).
La rencontre, tellement rythmée, se déroule sans mêlée pendant une demi-heure, et Florent Guion entre seulement à l’heure de jeu. Malgré une fin de match plus difficile, les Agenais, héroïques jusqu’au bout, tiendront un succès qui devrait leur redonner du baume au cœur.
SU Agen 39 – Biarritz Olympique 26
M.-T. : 26-19, 8 169 spectateurs.
Arbitre : Benjamin Hernandez.
Évolution du score : 5-0, 5-7, 5-10, 5-14, 5-19, 12-19, 19-19, 26-19 ; 29-19, 32-19, 39-19, 39-26.
Vainqueurs : 5 E Tolot (3, 40), Muscarditz (28), Gayraud (33), Ramoka (61) ; 4 T (28, 33, 40, 61) et 2 P Searle (49, 58).
Vaincus : 4 E Fa’asalele (8), Tapie (21), Retière (25), Dolhagaray (79) ; 1 T Retière (8), 2 T Dolhagaray (21, 79).
AGEN : Tolot (Dayral, 70) ; Martins, Muscarditz (cap.) (Ramoka, 74), Ramoka (Garrigues, 65), Etcheverry ; (o) Searle, (m) Bellot (Idjellidaine, 69) ; Olmstead (Lokotui, 55), Gayraud (Guion, 63), Bonnet (Gayraud, 77) ; Eissmann (Madigan, 53), Farré (Olmstead, 67) ; Burin (Farrance, 61), Jouvin (Socino, 40), Lombard-Buret.
Exp. temp. : Etcheverry (39).
Exp. déf. : Lombard-Buret (23).
BIARRITZ : Cordin (Dolhagaray, 38) ; Tapie (Morgan, 74), Acebes, Morgan (Vergnaud, 59), Guillemin ; (o) Retière (Dolhagaray, 10-21), (m) Aurrekoetxea ; Imaz Agirre (Du Preez, 40), Hébert, Hourcade (Douglas, 60) ; Fa’asalele (Hourcade, 70), Matthews (Dakuwaqa, 45) ; El Fakir (Shengelia, 60), Beheregaray (Tolai, 49), Nutsubidze (Taofifenua, 49).
Exp. temp. : Beheregaray (39), Morgan (48).
La note du match : 16/20.
Les hommes du match : Valentin GAYRAUD, Peyo MUSCARDITZ (Agen).

author: Castingshadows (invalid@example.com)
title: First experiment with sandalwood successful!
text:
[Castingshadows](/community/members/castingshadows.26290853/)
Well-known member
- Apr 14, 2020
- 3,061
- 2,665
I have a large collection of high quality sandalwood oils and I’ve had this itch for years to start making my own blends according to my own personal taste. With this experiment I wanted to take my sinking grade Indonesian Sandalwood roots distillation that already showcased warm, boozy amber notes with rich, spicy, woodsy qualities and expand on the vertical and horizontal scent spectrum. In other words I wanted to enrich the top notes and extend the basenotes. I didn’t want to change the inherent nature of the sandalwood but rather create an interesting base I can use in other blends.
Okay so heres the materials I used:
Fraterworks Epice FW
Fraterworks Absolute Ambergris
Fraterworks Labdanum Absolute (dark)
Fraterworks Olibanum Couer MD
Fraterworks Ambre Royale
Heres my approach (all materials undiluted except labdanum which is 50%):
2 grams of sandalwood
1 tiny drop absolute ambergris
5 tiny drops labdanum
3 tiny drops Olibanum
5 drops Ambre Royale
Tiny plastic toothpick dipped in Epice
Obviously this is completely rudimentary and not scientific nor professional in any capacity and I know I broke tons of perfumery rules by not weighing anything, prediluting materials, or using tiny amounts for experimenting. I got excited and didn’t want to wait for my equipment to get here so I used some pipettes I had laying around and eyeballed everything.
What surprised me the most was Epice FW. This material has such a gorgeous, soapy, vintage quality that brings out old stock Mysore vibes in the Sandalwood. It ever so gently creates a spicy floral note I didn’t expect to happen. I barely used any here yet it helped to create beautiful lift in the opening along with the gentle citric qualities present. The booze also takes on a slight egg nog aroma in that it’s boozy but spiced. The florals are gorgeous here and I’m actually surprised at how much they feel like they were always a part of the oil.
The other materials aren’t as present but they are felt in texture and performance. The amber notes literally round out the base of the oil and makes the material feel huge as if it’s a perfume in its own right while still smelling like Sandalwood. The sweetness only helps to expand on the amber notes already present. I need to use more labdanum and olibanum though as I can safely say now these materials will synergistically enhance the aroma.
The performance more than anything caught me off guard. This has solid projection which is way stronger than I thought it would be so that’s a huge plus especially for fixative properties.
I have some dreamwood I want to add in order to bring out some dry, woody qualities to balance the boozy warmth. I’m not sure where to start with that because I’m pretty sure it’ll need precision and dilution as I really don’t want to overdose so I’ll wait for my scale and glass to get here before I do.
Most of all I just had fun. It feels great to wear this on my skin and the wheels are already turning on how to use this base material for a spicy pineapple mulkullat I’ve always wanted to make.
Okay so heres the materials I used:
Fraterworks Epice FW
Fraterworks Absolute Ambergris
Fraterworks Labdanum Absolute (dark)
Fraterworks Olibanum Couer MD
Fraterworks Ambre Royale
Heres my approach (all materials undiluted except labdanum which is 50%):
2 grams of sandalwood
1 tiny drop absolute ambergris
5 tiny drops labdanum
3 tiny drops Olibanum
5 drops Ambre Royale
Tiny plastic toothpick dipped in Epice
Obviously this is completely rudimentary and not scientific nor professional in any capacity and I know I broke tons of perfumery rules by not weighing anything, prediluting materials, or using tiny amounts for experimenting. I got excited and didn’t want to wait for my equipment to get here so I used some pipettes I had laying around and eyeballed everything.
What surprised me the most was Epice FW. This material has such a gorgeous, soapy, vintage quality that brings out old stock Mysore vibes in the Sandalwood. It ever so gently creates a spicy floral note I didn’t expect to happen. I barely used any here yet it helped to create beautiful lift in the opening along with the gentle citric qualities present. The booze also takes on a slight egg nog aroma in that it’s boozy but spiced. The florals are gorgeous here and I’m actually surprised at how much they feel like they were always a part of the oil.
The other materials aren’t as present but they are felt in texture and performance. The amber notes literally round out the base of the oil and makes the material feel huge as if it’s a perfume in its own right while still smelling like Sandalwood. The sweetness only helps to expand on the amber notes already present. I need to use more labdanum and olibanum though as I can safely say now these materials will synergistically enhance the aroma.
The performance more than anything caught me off guard. This has solid projection which is way stronger than I thought it would be so that’s a huge plus especially for fixative properties.
I have some dreamwood I want to add in order to bring out some dry, woody qualities to balance the boozy warmth. I’m not sure where to start with that because I’m pretty sure it’ll need precision and dilution as I really don’t want to overdose so I’ll wait for my scale and glass to get here before I do.
Most of all I just had fun. It feels great to wear this on my skin and the wheels are already turning on how to use this base material for a spicy pineapple mulkullat I’ve always wanted to make.

author: La Gaceta
title: Inundaciones en España: “Las cuatro horas de diluvio aún suenan en nuestra cabeza”
text: “Los servicios van y vienen, el agua está cortada. La luz, también, e internet se corta todo el tiempo. Los supermercados de la zona vacíos o inundados y no llegan los abastecimientos porque las carreteras y puentes cortados, la gente camina kilómetros para conseguir comida en las zonas no afectadas”. Este es el panorama desolador que pinta a LA GACETA Marcia Mordini, una tucumana que vive desde hace más de 20 años en [España](https://www.lagaceta.com.ar/nota/1057975/mundo/argentina-ofrecio-asistencia-humanitaria-espana-tragicas-inundaciones.html), en la zona montañosa de Valencia, cercana a donde ocurrieron las peores [inundaciones](https://www.lagaceta.com.ar/nota/1057932/lgplay/tucumana-conto-como-vivio-impacto-inundaciones-valencia.html) en un siglo. Su casa, en Torrente, quedó fuera del área arrasada por el aluvión de agua y lodo. “Nosotros estamos lejos del pueblo, más en la montaña y hemos tenido suerte, sólo con pérdidas materiales -describe-. Pero el ruido constante de cuatro horas de diluvio, con granizo y viento, aún suena en nuestras cabezas”. La situación que pinta es “terrorífica”. Torrent está a no más de 10 kilómetros de Paiporta, una de las ciudades que sufrió el mayor impacto del fenómeno llamado DANA (acrónimo de Depresión Aislada en Niveles Altos) y conocido popularmente como “la gota fría”. En Torrent y pueblos cercanos “hay vecinos que no pueden salir de casa porque los coches amontonados no los dejan”, cuenta Marcia. Hasta ayer, el pueblo estaba incomunicado con la capital de Valencia, Aldaia y alrededores. A las personas que quedaron atrapadas en edificios, en las ciudades y pueblos más golpeados, “les dan comida y agua por el balcón -relata-. Los que quisieron salvar los autos de las cocheras en subsuelo han muerto ahogados. Se ven (coches) en las calles, amontonados, muchos con sus dueños adentro, muertos”. En la entrada de Paiporta, la entrada del pueblo, la furiosa ola marrón dejó amontonados los coches en una plaza cercana al cuartel de la Guardia Civil. No importa el feriado Mientras termina de llegar la ayuda oficial, una multitud de voluntarios se dirigió a los alrededores de Valencia para auxiliar a los vecinos atrapados en el infierno de barro que trajo la riada. Es el Día de Todos los Santos, viernes y feriado en España y ya antes del mediodía, una multitud cruzaba apresurada los puentes que unen la ciudad de Valencia con la periferia sur, llevando palas, escobas o agua. “Hemos tomado lo que teníamos en casa, y a ayudar”, cuenta Federico Martínez, con una pala al hombro. Llegado de una localidad del otro lado de Valencia, camina junto a unos amigos hacia la zona afectada. Tras conocer la magnitud de esta tragedia sin precedentes, que ya suma más de 200 fallecidos, miles de personas se lanzaron caminando hacia las zonas arrasadas, todavía cortadas al tráfico. “Esto emociona, pone los pelos de punta”, explica este ingeniero de 55 años con la voz entrecortada. A medida que se avanza por las huertas ahora devastadas que unen la capital valenciana, donde no llegó la riada, se multiplica el barro y las huellas del desastre que ha dejado a miles y miles de personas sin agua y sin luz desde la fatídica tarde del martes. “Toda ayuda es poca. Menos mal que España es solidaria”, opina Alicia Izquierdo. Junto a su hermana Marta caminan empujando dos carros de compra con alimentos hacia la casa de su hermano, que vive en Paiporta, una localidad de más de 25.000 habitantes convertida en el epicentro de la destrucción. Tampoco lo pensó mucho Tamara Gil cuando se lanzó a caminar los tres kilómetros de huerta y polígonos industriales que separan Valencia de Paiporta. A paso ligero, va empujando un carro metálico con agua y todo lo que creyó que podía ser útil. Quiere llegar cuanto antes al colegio donde es profesora y del que se fue el martes por la tarde, poco antes de que la riada arrasara Paiporta. Tras aquella noche que pasó al teléfono esperando noticias, aún desconoce si todos sus alumnos están bien. A pura voluntad Las autoridades intentaron disuadir a los voluntarios argumentando que podrían obstaculizar las vías de paso de los equipos de rescate, aunque van a pie. Muchos cargan sus garrafas y bolsas por las calles cubiertas de barro que llevan al auditorio municipal. Allí, junto a los coches amontonados frente a la fachada principal, han apartado ramas y escombros para establecer un punto de distribución de ayuda. Después de casi tres días sin agua ni luz, y con los comercios del municipio arrasados, decenas de vecinos aguardan en una larga fila. “Lo primordial es la comida y el agua”, explica junto a su esposa Ramón Vicente, de 73 años, ambos damnificados. Ellos vivieron la riada de 1957, que anegó la ciudad de Valencia, dejó decenas de muertos y marcó a generaciones de valencianos. El desastre actual ha pulverizado todos los registros.“Me acuerdo de aquello y la ciudad pasó mucho tiempo para recuperarse”, lamenta junto a su esposa Fausti, preocupada por cómo podrá conseguir los medicamentos que necesita, en un hospital al que ahora no puede llegar. “A la gente mayor esto nos va a pasar factura”, suspira. Falta organización En cada calle, vecinos y voluntarios tratan de achicar montañas de barro todavía húmedo y viscoso de las casas. Todo es marrón ahora en Paiporta, donde ninguna planta baja se ha salvado de la crecida. De la iglesia principal del municipio, los voluntarios siguen sacando baldes de barro, de un interior donde el agua llega a los tobillos. Frente al barranco, un grupo de voluntarios trata de apartar el barro que llena una de las vías. “Falta organización. La gente quiere ayudar, pero no hay nadie que organice”, observa Montse Fernández, que ha venido desde Godella, al norte de Valencia. “No hay suficientes bomberos, no llegan las palas… Aquí todo es particular”, explica Paco Clemente, un farmacéutico de 33 años que ha venido de la cercana Torrente, mientras saca montones de fango del interior de la casa de unos amigos. Al otro lado del barranco, Estefanía García camina con precaución entre el barro con su bebé de un mes y medio dormida en los brazos. Su familia le está esperando junto a su hija de dos años para irse de Paiporta a un lugar más seguro. Han sido días terribles, pero pese a todo se siente afortunada. “Hemos perdido los coches, parte de la casa, pero estamos vivos”, explica con los ojos vidriosos.
